instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-2523, green light ok, PPBUS_G3H, PP3V3_S5 ok, won't turn on (over 10min foreplay)
threads.message:
Hi guys its me again.


This one has no turn-on pads so you have to use your tongue. last joke before giving up - there is 3.3v on R5710 but nothing happens when I take this to ground.

It was ld and gave it a bath, green light came on after gently reflowing the SMC with some flux.

L7220 seems not shorted to ground but after applying power and disconnecting, there is a .001 to .003 reading diode mode with respect to ground.

Large mofo this one so I do not know where to go next... I have not tried injecting voltage at all.


Thank you guys.

threads.title: 820-2523, green light ok, PPBUS_G3H, PP3V3_S5 ok, won't turn on (over 10min foreplay)
820-2523, green light ok, PPBUS_G3H, PP3V3_S5 ok, won't turn on (over 10min foreplay)
threads.message: after duke's questions, does this have burned looking crap by U7100 like most of these liquid damaged ones do?

threads.title: 820-2523, green light ok, PPBUS_G3H, PP3V3_S5 ok, won't turn on (over 10min foreplay)
threads.message: so PPBUS_G3H: 12.5V, PP3V3_S5: 3.25V, U7100 area nice and shiny...

threads.title: 820-2523, green light ok, PPBUS_G3H, PP3V3_S5 ok, won't turn on (over 10min foreplay)
threads.message: when you press the power button does PM_SLP_S4_L rise to 3.3v?

threads.title: 820-2523, green light ok, PPBUS_G3H, PP3V3_S5 ok, won't turn on (over 10min foreplay)
threads.message:
it does not.

measured at R7812... also checked continuity to R7810, both resistors at their nominal values.

threads.title: 820-2523, green light ok, PPBUS_G3H, PP3V3_S5 ok, won't turn on (over 10min foreplay)
threads.message: Is SMC_ADAPTER_EN high? Does PM_PWRBTN_L move at all when you press the power button?
